Results module¶

Results(model, free_parameter_values)

This class stores results from an ODE simulation.
class Results.Results(model, free_parameter_values)[source]

Bases: object

This class stores results from an ODE simulation. Minimally, results for temporal variables are required to be set. Other results may be calculated and saved from Model as needed.

Variables

  • results – 2D dictionary of results. First key is indicies of free parameter for current data to present. Second key is name of quantity to retrieve results of. Value is array of quantitiy values over time.

  • model – Model to calculated results from

  • free_parameter_values – dictionary of values for free parameters. Key is name of free parameter. Value is possible values for free parameter.

  • general_equilibrium_forms – dictionary of symbolic equilibrium expressions. Key is name of variable. Value is symbolic expression. This attribute is so that equilibria only need to be calculated once. They are reused after their initial calculation.

getFourierTransform(index, name)[source]

Get Fourier transform of results.

Parameters

  • self¶ – Results to retreive results from

  • index¶ – index of results. This is a tuple of indicies. The index of the tuple corresponds to the parameter in free parameters. The index within the tuple corresponds to the value of the parameter in its set of possible values.

  • name¶ – name of quantity to retreive Fourier transform of

getHolderMean(index, name, order=1, **kwargs)[source]

Get Holder mean for results.

Parameters

getOscillationAmplitude(index, name, **kwargs)[source]

getOscillationFrequency(index, name, calculation_method='autocorrelation', condensing_method='average', **kwargs)[source]

Get oscillation frequency for quantity.

Parameters

  • self¶ – Results to retrieve quantity results from

  • index¶ – index of results. This is a tuple of indicies. The index of the tuple corresponds to the parameter in free parameters. The index within the tuple corresponds to the value of the parameter in its set of possible values.

  • name¶ – name of quantity to retrieve frequency for

  • calculation_method¶ – method used to calculate frequencies. “maxima_separation” uses peak-to-peak separation of waveform. “minima_separation” uses trough-to-trough separation of waveform. “extrema_separation” uses peaks and troughs separation of waveform. “maxima_fourier_[n]” uses peak-to-peak separation of Fourier transform (i.e. separation of harmonics). This method uses separations for the first n maxima. “autocorrelation” uses autocorrelation of waveform. This method uses the argument of the first local maximum, excluding zero.

  • condensing_method¶ – method used to “average” frequencies. “average” uses arithmetic mean of frequencies. “maximum” uses maximum of frequencies. “minimum” uses minium of frequencies. “initial” uses first frequency in frequencies. “final” uses last frequency in frequencies.

  • kwargs¶ – additional arguments to pass into getResultsOverTime()

Return type

float

getResultsOverTime(index, names=None, transform_name='None', condensor_name='None', **condensor_kwargs)[source]

Get results for variable or function over time. Results are evaluated from simulation. Optionally perform a transformation on the quantity. Optionally condense variable values into one value.

__Recursion Base__

return results for single variable: names [str]

Parameters

  • self¶ – SimulationWindowRunner to retrieve results from

  • index¶ – index of results. This is a tuple of indicies. The index of the tuple corresponds to the parameter in free parameters. The index within the tuple corresponds to the value of the parameter in its set of possible values.

  • names¶ – name(s) of variable/function(s) to retrieve results for

  • transform_name¶ – transform to perform on results. “Fourier” - Fourier transform.

  • condensor_name¶ – analysis to perform on results to reduce into one (or few) floats. “Frequency” - calculate frequency of oscillation

Return type

Union[float, ndarray]

getResultsOverTimePerParameter(index, parameter_name, quantity_names, **kwargs)[source]

Get free-parameter values and “averaged” quantity values.

Parameters

  • self¶ – SimulationWindowRunner to retrieve results from

  • index¶ – index of results. This is a tuple of indicies. The index of the tuple corresponds to the parameter in free parameters. The index within the tuple corresponds to the value of the parameter in its set of possible values.

  • parameter_name¶ – name of free parameter to average quantity results over.

  • quantity_names¶ – name of quantity to average results over

  • kwargs¶ – additional arguments to pass into getResultsOverTime()

Return type

Tuple[ndarray, …]

Returns

tuple of results. First index gives parameter values. Second-last index gives quantity results; one set of quantity results per index.

setEquilibriumForms(equilibrium_forms=None)[source]

Set symbolic expressions for equilibrium variables. These expressions are simplified, except variables and free parameters are kept symbolic. Equilibria may be set manually or calculated automatically from the stored Model.

Parameters

  • self¶ – Results to set equilibria for

  • equilibrium_forms¶ – dictionary of equilibria for variables. Key is symbolic variable. Value is symbolic equilibrium expression of variable.

Return type

None

setResults(index, results, name=None)[source]

Save results from simulation.

Parameters

  • self¶ – SimulationWindowRunner to save results in

  • index¶ – index of parameter value for free parameter

  • results¶ – results to save at index. This must be a list of floats if name is specified. This must be a dictionary if name is not specified. Key is name of variable. Value is list of floats for variable over time.

  • name¶ – name of quantity to set results for

Return type

None
